item.title: returnNullHypotheses when runRecognitionOnWavFileAtPath
item.dc:creator: buec
item.description:
Hi,

I have just noticed that the returnNullHypotheses doesn’t work, when running runRecognitionOnWavFileAtPath. I think it would be very useful if you get null hypotheses when trying to test something.

Regards
Matthias

item.title: Reply To: returnNullHypotheses when runRecognitionOnWavFileAtPath
item.dc:creator: Halle Winkler
item.description:
Hi Matthias,

Thanks for your feedback. runRecognitionOnWavFileAtPath is deprecated as a method of testing now that there is the much more real-world test approach available by using PocketsphinxController’s pathToTestFile property â€“ among its many benefits is that unlike runRecognitionOnWavFileAtPath it uses the main recognition loop, so as test-affecting features are added (like returnNullHypotheses, smartCMN,) they are automatically supported in testing as well.
